newsitem.title: TAIWAN: CHINESE OLYMPIC CHAMPIONS VISIT TAIWAN.
newsitem.headline: CHINESE OLYMPIC CHAMPIONS VISIT TAIWAN.

text.p: A group of Atlanta Olympic gold medallists from China arrived in Taiwan on Saturday to promote sports exchanges between the two political rivals.
The visit was originally scheduled for February 20 but was postponed because of the death of China's paramount leader Deng Xiaoping.
The Chinese delegation, which includes women's 5,000 metres gold medallist Wang Junxia and women's diving gold medallist Fu Mingxia, was invited by Taiwan's education ministry.
They will visit Taiwan's colleges and training centres and meet athletes and coaches on the island over the next week.
Although Taiwan and China have been political rivals since they split after a civil war ended in 1949, cultural and economic ties have flourished with an unofficial thaw that began in the 1980s.
The two sides competed in the same Olympics for the first time at the 1984 Los Angeles Games.
